page.title: 16OUR UNIQUE AMPNEY POUND TREE
page.content: An elm tree grew in the middle of { {Ampney Crucis}called{"the Pound Tree". There was a legend that, if the pound tree died, no children would be born in the village. The Pound Tree got Dutch Elm disease and slowly died. It was cut down. For three years no children were born but a tiny sucker grew from the root of the dead elm and Mark Hughes, James Hickson and Sophie Bird were born in 1980. The sucker has grown into a sturdy little tree. {Squire Blackwell}from Ampney Park went off on his white horse, but the horse returned without its rider who was never found. In the years when the Ampney Brook dries up, his ghost is supposed to appear! {Ghosts}are said to haunt the A 417 by the Ivy Church (Ampney St. Mary).
